column4: soo anyone? video card problems for ati... inverted colors in mplayer. maybe a xorg.conf problem
Only in that one program would most likely not be ati or xorg problem
actually, vlc is screwed up as well. and it started happening after i messed up with xorg.conf
post your xorg so people can check it out
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/49489/
Did you edit it manually, or did you use sudo dpkg etc..
i used sudo dpkg...does it look like i edited it manually?
look in the xorg folder for your backup and compare them or replace the existing with your old one
No it looks like it was edited with dpkg and no res are listed at all.
look in etc/X11 and look for an xorg followed by a bunch of numbers.. that will be the automatic backup
I looked in xorg.conf.original-0 and it had the driver name ("ati" which is the proprietary driver which i dled) under the video card. its not in my current xorg.conf. is that the problem?
make a backup of your current.. replace with your old and see if it solves the prob.. if so.. merge the two with what you need
ok. im gonna restart x now and see if it works
good luck
so it did exactly the same thing that it did last time i tried to change xorg.conf. it disabled my proprietary driver which i downloaded for my ATI card and went into failsafe mode.
I know that if i ineable the driver it will work fine, but the video problem will stay
still here?
not really
Yes, I am here, just waiting for neice to deliver her baby
haha sorry if im distracting you or anything. so, any ideas?
that was the xorg ati card video color problem?
yes, im the one with the ATI xorg.conf problem
Ask wols.. but I would reinstall the restriced drivers...
i tried reverting to an old xorg.conf, but it did the same thing that it did last time i tried changing xorg.conf - it disabled my ATI driver and went into failsafe mode
